content.description: Lowball, dabby, traverse...but the movement and rock quality are greatSit start, Left hand on a crimp pinch, right hand low good undercling. Shoot up to the sloper and begin traversing left.
content.location: Low and right of Beautiful choss, between Gym Slab

content.description: Stand up on the great foothold on the left arete and reach way out to a good handhold on the right. Climb the vertical face to the top using both aretes. Fun. Definitely not a slab.
One move stand start to I Dig. Feels like a comp/slab dyno Stand start on small crimps at chest height and do a big move to the left sloper arete
Sit start and climb the obvious fin with sidepulls and jugs. Short but fun.

climbs.name: Deep Greedy And Googling Every Corner

content.description: Another dumb one move wonderBad holds, weird body position, pretty cool top outStarting holds are a high right hand slopey sidepull and a bad low left undercling

Start standing on the ground with a left hand crimp and right crimping behind the shelf. Figure out how to get established with your feet on the shelf and grab the boulder's top. Battle through the tree branches to top out. Descent is down the sketchy slab on the back. Some loose flakes were knocked off before the FRA.

pathTokens: Burr Pond State Park / Paugnut State Forest

content.description: Large grouping of boulders that appear to have been all one piece several thousand years ago.  Two of the big ones (approx 12’ tall) are in almost a circular configuration with each other creating a boulder grotto of sorts.  They are close enough to each other that one crash pad setup may work for all three boulders. One has a narrow double-arete face, and the others have slight overhangs.  Landing area clear but nearby trees have some small branches in the way
